shame they teach you c before c++, now you will have bad habits forever

The majority of C++ programmers don’t use the C++ language effectively anyway, so you get a lot of garbage written in that language. and here is the final project: a phone book

[code]#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <ctype.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <assert.h>
#include <stdbool.h>

//**********************************************************************
// Linked List Definitions
// Define your linked list node and pointer types
// here for use throughout the file.

typedef struct entry
{
char last[1024], first[1024], address[1024], num[1024];
struct entry link;
}Entry, EntryPointer;
//********************************************************************
// Linked List Function Declarations
//
// Functions that modify the linked list.
// Declare your linked list functions here.

EntryPointer deleteEntry (EntryPointer head, char last[]);
EntryPointer deleteList (EntryPointer head);
EntryPointer findEntrybyLast (EntryPointer head, char last[]);
EntryPointer findEntrybyNum (EntryPointer head, char num[]);
EntryPointer insertInOrder (EntryPointer head, char last[], char first[], char address[], char num[]);
EntryPointer newEntry (char last[], char first[], char address[], char num[], EntryPointer link);
void printEntry (EntryPointer head);
void printList (EntryPointer head);

//**********************************************************************
// Support Function Declarations
//

void safegets (char s[], int arraySize); // gets without buffer overflow
void familyNameDuplicate (char familyName[]); // marker/tester friendly
void familyNameFound (char familyName[]); // functions to print
void familyNameNotFound (char familyName[]); // messages to user
void familyNameDeleted (char familyName[]);
void phoneNumberFound (char phoneNumber[]);
void phoneNumberNotFound (char phoneNumber[]);
void printPhoneBookEmpty (void);
void printPhoneBookTitle (void);

//**********************************************************************
// Program-wide Constants
//

const int MAX_LENGTH = 1023;
const char NULL_CHAR = ‘\0’;
const char NEWLINE = ‘\n’;

//**********************************************************************
// Main Program
//

int main (void)
{
// Starting Messages
const char bannerString[]
= “Personal Phone Book Maintenance Program.\n\n”;
const char commandList[]
= “Commands are I (insert), D (delete), S (search by name),\n”
" R (reverse search by phone #), P (print), Q (quit).\n";

// Declaration of Variables
char response;
char input[MAX_LENGTH+1];
char last[MAX_LENGTH+1], first[MAX_LENGTH+1], address[MAX_LENGTH+1], num[MAX_LENGTH+1], key[MAX_LENGTH+1];

// Declare linked list head.
EntryPointer head = NULL;

// announce start of program
printf("%s",bannerString);
printf("%s",commandList);

// Loop while response is not "Q".
do
{
    printf("\nCommand?: ");
    safegets(input,MAX_LENGTH+1);
    // Response is first char entered by user.
    // Convert to uppercase to simplify later comparisons.
    response = toupper(input[0]);

    if (response == 'I')
    {
        // Insert a phone book entry into the linked list.
        printf("  family name: ");
        safegets(last, MAX_LENGTH+1);
        printf("  first name: ");
        safegets(first, MAX_LENGTH+1);
        printf("  address: ");
        safegets(address, MAX_LENGTH+1);
        printf("  phone number: ");
        safegets(num, MAX_LENGTH+1);

        // If name is already in phonebook, print message indicating duplicate.
        if (findEntrybyLast(head, last) != NULL)
            familyNameDuplicate(last);
        else
        // Otherwise, create a new entry and maintain alphabetical order by last name.
            head = insertInOrder(head, last, first, address, num);
    }
    else if (response == 'D')
    {
        // Delete an phone book entry from the list.

        // If phonebook already empty, print message.
        if (head == NULL)
            printPhoneBookEmpty();
        else
        {
            // Otherwise, prompt user for a last name whose entry is to be deleted.
            printf("\nEnter family name for entry to delete: ");
            safegets(key, MAX_LENGTH+1);

            EntryPointer temp = findEntrybyLast(head, key);

            // If entry not found, print message.
            if (temp == NULL)
                familyNameNotFound(key);
            else
            {
                head = deleteEntry(head, key);
                familyNameDeleted(key);
            }
        }
    }
    else if (response == 'S')
    {
        // Search for an phone book entry by family name.

        // If phonebook already empty, print message.
        if (head == NULL)
            printPhoneBookEmpty();
        else
        {
            // Otherwise, search for entry using last name indicated by user.
            printf("\nEnter family name to search for: ");
            safegets(key, MAX_LENGTH+1);

            EntryPointer temp = findEntrybyLast(head, key);

            if (temp == NULL)
                familyNameNotFound(key);
            else
            {
                familyNameFound(key);
                printEntry(temp);
            }
        }
    }
    else if (response == 'R')
    {
        // Search for an phone book entry by phone number.

        // If phonebook already empty, print message.
        if (head == NULL)
            printPhoneBookEmpty();
        else
        {
            // Otherwise, search for entry using phone number indicated by user.
            printf("\nEnter phone number to search for: ");
            safegets(key, MAX_LENGTH+1);

            EntryPointer temp = findEntrybyNum(head, key);

            if (temp == NULL)
                phoneNumberNotFound(key);
            else
            {
                phoneNumberFound(key);
                printEntry(temp);
            }
        }
    }
    else if (response == 'P')
    {
        // Print the phone book.
        // If phonebook already empty, print message.

        if (head == NULL)
            printPhoneBookEmpty();
        else
        {
            printPhoneBookTitle();
            printList(head);
        }
    }
    else if (response == 'Q')
    {
        ; // do nothing, we'll catch this below
    }
    else
    {
        // do this if no command matched ...
        printf("\nInvalid command.\n%s\n",commandList);
    }
} while (response != 'Q');

// Delete the whole phone book linked list.
head = deleteList(head);

// Print phonebook empty message.
printPhoneBookEmpty();

// Print the linked list to confirm deletion.
printList(head);

return 0;

}

//**********************************************************************
// Support Function Definitions

// Function to get a line of input without overflowing target char array.
void safegets (char s[], int arraySize)
{
int i = 0, maxIndex = arraySize-1;
char c;
while (i < maxIndex && (c = getchar()) != NEWLINE)
{
s[i] = c;
i = i + 1;
}
s[i] = NULL_CHAR;
}

// Function to call when user is trying to insert a family name
// that is already in the book.
void familyNameDuplicate (char familyName[])
{
printf("\nAn entry for <%s> is already in the phone book!\n"
“New entry not entered.\n”,familyName);
}

// Function to call when a family name was found in the phone book.
void familyNameFound (char familyName[])
{
printf("\nThe family name <%s> was found in the phone book.\n",
familyName);
}

// Function to call when a family name was not found in the phone book.
void familyNameNotFound (char familyName[])
{
printf("\nThe family name <%s> is not in the phone book.\n",
familyName);
}

// Function to call when a family name that is to be deleted
// was found in the phone book.
void familyNameDeleted (char familyName[])
{
printf("\nDeleting entry for family name <%s> from the phone book.\n",
familyName);
}

// Function to call when a phone number was found in the phone book.
void phoneNumberFound (char phoneNumber[])
{
printf("\nThe phone number <%s> was found in the phone book.\n",
phoneNumber);
}

// Function to call when a phone number was not found in the phone book.
void phoneNumberNotFound (char phoneNumber[])
{
printf("\nThe phone number <%s> is not in the phone book.\n",
phoneNumber);
}

// Function to call when printing an empty phone book.
void printPhoneBookEmpty (void)
{
printf("\nThe phone book is empty.\n");
}

// Function to call to print title when whole phone book being printed.
void printPhoneBookTitle (void)
{
printf("\nMy Personal Phone Book: \n");
}

//**********************************************************************
// Add your functions below this line.

// Function to delete an entry.
EntryPointer deleteEntry (EntryPointer head, char last[])
{
// Declaration of variables
EntryPointer current = head, previous = NULL;
bool found = false;

// If input matches a current entry, found is set to true.
while (!found && current != NULL)
    if (strcmp(current->last, last) == 0)
        found = true;
    else
    {
        // Otherwise, keep on looking.
        previous = current;
        current = current->link;
    }

if (found)
    if (current == head)
        head = current->link;
    else
        previous->link = current->link;

return head;

}

EntryPointer deleteList (EntryPointer head)
{
EntryPointer next;
while (head != NULL)
{
next = head->link;
free(head);
head = next;
}
return NULL;
}

EntryPointer findEntrybyLast (EntryPointer head, char last[])
{
EntryPointer p = head;

while (p != NULL && strcmp(p->last, last) != 0)
    p = p->link;

return p;

}

EntryPointer findEntrybyNum (EntryPointer head, char num[])
{
EntryPointer p = head;

while (p != NULL && strcmp(p->num, num) != 0)
    p = p->link;

return p;

}

EntryPointer insertInOrder (EntryPointer head, char last[], char first[], char address[], char num[])
{
EntryPointer curr = head, prev = NULL;
bool located = false;

while (!located && curr != NULL)
    if (strcmp(last, curr->last) < 0)
        located = true;
    else
    {
        prev = curr;
        curr = curr->link;
    }

EntryPointer newItem = newEntry(last, first, address, num, curr);

if (curr == head)
    head = newItem;
else
    prev->link = newItem;

return head;

}

// Function to create a new entry.
EntryPointer newEntry (char last[], char first[], char address[], char num[], EntryPointer link)
{
// Allocate memory for new entry.
EntryPointer p = (EntryPointer)malloc(sizeof(Entry));

if (p == NULL)
    printf("\nOut of memory - cannot create node\n");
else
{
    strcpy(p->last, last);
    strcpy(p->first, first);
    strcpy(p->address, address);
    strcpy(p->num, num);
    p->link = link;
}
return p;

}

void printEntry (EntryPointer head)
{
EntryPointer current = head;

printf("\n%s\n", current->last);
printf("%s\n", current->first);
printf("%s\n", current->address);
printf("%s\n", current->num);

}

void printList (EntryPointer head)
{
EntryPointer current = head;

while (current != NULL)
{
    printf("\n%s\n", current->last);
    printf("%s\n", current->first);
    printf("%s\n", current->address);
    printf("%s\n", current->num);
    current = current->link;
}

}
[/code]
